Class IntermediateAI

  • java.lang.Object
    • IntermediateAI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Player

    public class IntermediateAI
extends java.lang.Object
implements Player
    Intermediate AI class which is a simplified version of the Expert AI

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IntermediateAI() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double alphabeta(Board state, int depth, double alpha, double beta, boolean maximisingPlayer)
      Uses the minimax algorithm with alpha-beta pruning to simulate a tree depth of 6 moves.
      int calculateMove(Board state)
      Calls the alpha-beta function on consecutive future turns originating from a single move and returns a score of that move
      double calculateScore(Board state)
      Scans the board and adds or takes away score based on tokens located in given columns and the player which owns the token Takes away score for opponent turns and adds score for its own tokens
      int getMove(Board state)
      Calls a search function giving costs to all available moves and returns the best move based on cost found

      • calculateMove

        public int calculateMove(Board state)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        cost found from scanning given board

      • alphabeta

        public double alphabeta(Board state,
               int depth,
               double alpha,
               double beta,
               boolean maximisingPlayer)
        Uses the minimax algorithm with alpha-beta pruning to simulate a tree depth of 6 moves. Then, it calls a heuristic function which evaluates the board state
        Parameters:
        state - Current state of the board
        depth - The current move depth of the tree
        alpha - The max value of two scores for the maximising player
        beta - The min value of two scores for the minimising player
        maximisingPlayer - A boolean which states if it's the AI's turn
        Returns:
        Returns a score if the depth reaches 0 or gameOver, otherwise it tries to prune non-optimal moves

      • calculateScore

        public double calculateScore(Board state)
        Scans the board and adds or takes away score based on tokens located in given columns and the player which owns the token Takes away score for opponent turns and adds score for its own tokens
        Parameters:
        state -
        Returns:
        score found scanning the board
